title: Toyota Mirai
summary: The Toyota Mirai (from Mirai (未来), Japanese for "future") is a mid-size hydrogen fuel cell vehicle (FCV) manufactured by Toyota, and represents one of the first FCV automobiles to be mass-produced and sold commercially.[2][3] The Mirai was unveiled at the November 2014 Los Angeles Auto Show.[4] As of December 2019, global sales totalled 10,250 Mirais. The top-selling markets were the U.S. with 6,200 units, Japan with 3,500 and Europe with 640.[5] As of October 2021, US and Canada sales totalled 8,902 and 158 units respectively.[6]
